result.execSummary:
Sarah M. Olson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Sarah M. Olson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah M. Olson

defendant.name: Olson, Sarah M.
defendant.address: 221 S Rebecca Street, Gays Mills, WI 54631

records.addlTxt:
2:47 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Sarah M. Olson in court, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court reviews nature of charge in complaint with defendant
Inquires whether defendant intends to waive extradition
questions by defendant re: waiver of extradition -  Court explains options to def, and procedure if waived.
Def. states she wishes to waive extradition

Court reviews waiver of extradition form with defendant
Defendant initials each paragraph on waiver form and signs waiver.

Court finds the waiver was knowingly and voluntarily made, accepts defendant's waiver, and signs order.
